title: WCAS PSYCH 101-6-23 First-Year Seminar
class_attributes:
WCAS First-Year Seminar

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: In this seminar we will examine the nature of the mind from both Buddhist and traditional Western psychological perspectives. We will employ Buddhist techniques for investigating mental activity by incorporating a brief meditation period into class and homework activities. We will also examine written materials from both traditions, and these will form the primary basis for class discussion and written assignments.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Written assignments, class attendance, and participation.

Meditation logs (4 x 5 pts): 20%
1st Short paper: 15%
2nd Short paper: 20%
3rd Short paper: 25%
Attendance and participation (including discussion board): 20%

NUMBER OF WRITING ASSIGNMENTS AND THEIR LENGTH:
1. Four one-to-two page summaries of meditation experience.
2. Three short papers (3-10 pages, draft and final version) researching and critically evaluating a question. The first of these papers will be shorter and the last longer.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Thich Nhat Hanh (1996), The Miracle of Mindfulness: A Manual on Meditation. Beacon Press; ISBN: 0807012327, 1996

Other Readings will be provided as PDFs on the course Canvas Site.
